Message.Msg: Sooner. If the committee rejects Icahn's offer as a NON-OFFER, they will just move forward with the only REAL offer.

Message.Title: Dell buyout group discounts company's dismal 1Q earnings
Message.Msg: May 22, 2013, 4:22pm CDT Dell buyout group discounts company's dismal 1Q earnings Christopher Calnan Staff Writer- Austin Business Journal Dell Inc.’s prospective buyout group is downplaying last week’s 79 percent decline in first-quarter profits. Tennessee-based Southeastern Asset Management Inc. wrote that Round Rock-based Dell’s (Nasdaq: DELL) performed well in the business division that matters most in the coming years — software and services. “Dell’s results are heavily skewed by a combination of headline-grabbing PC statistics and the significant investments being made in the future of the business,” the company wrote in a Wednesday filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. “The enterprise solutions, software and services business is Dell’s future, and we are highly encouraged by its continued outperformance.” Southeastern Asset Management and billionaire investor Carl Icahn are competing with an investor group led by Dell CEO Michael Dell to buyout the company’s shareholders. Dell (Nasdaq: DELL), the No. 3 computer maker in the world, employs 14,000 workers in Central Texas. Michael Dell’s group is proposing pay $24.4 billion – $13.65 per share – for the company. Icahn has characterized the buyout proposal as “the great giveaway.” Last week, Dell posted net income of $130 million on revenue of $14 billion, compared with a net income of $635 million on revenue of $14.4 billion during the same period last year.

Topic.Title: no deal with ichan dell deal in 6 months back to 12.00

Message.Msg: Plus you keep your shares I'm for that.

Simple solution to any long that worries that the deal may fail. Sell the Jan 2015 15 calls. Collect 33 cents each. Option 1, the stock backs off and deal disolves, you keep the 33 cents. Option 2, the deal goes thru at 13.65, and you keep the 33 cents. No matter how you look at it, you keep the 33 cents. What is NOT going to happen is a deal over 15. No magic offer will arrive to get shareholders one penny more than 13.65.
